title: Riot support is toxic
body:
TLDR; Account got permabanned unjustly, Riot support system didn't help,  and "diagnosed" me with suicide. I just want my account back and my case to serve as an example for future cases so this never happens again.

I have been playing League since season 3 and have invested over $1000 into this game. This is the only game I play and I have dedicated myself to it. About 2 weeks ago, my account got permabanned. In the couple games, I had used some light vulgar language (who doesn't), and so when my teammates got mad, they decided to report me and my account got flagged. Due to my account having a 2 week suspension in the past, this isolated incident resulted in a permaban.

I submitted many many support tickets, pleading that this was an isolated event and that they could even check my history to see that negative behavior had not occurred since the two week suspension. In most of the tickets, I had some elongated conversations in which the support member said that they see that this offense should not have resulted in a permaban, but because I had a 2 week suspension prior on the account, that is why it lead to the permaban and that they could not reverse it.

Many people who have encounters with Riot support know that they go by the script, and rarely ever look into context of the situation. I repeatedly explained that this was an isolated incident, and Riot support actually AGREED! The only problem being, they saw that I was right, agreed with me, but failed to act on it. The support members even claimed that if it were up to them, they wouldn't have thought to have permabanned me, but since it is not up to them, they can't reverse it.

In many of the tickets, I suggested I would do anything to get the account back, even suggesting a chat permaban. Seeing as how this would fix the so called "toxic" problem labeled on my account, this should've been more than enough reason to reverse the permaban. But none of them addressed my suggestion because they all knew it would solve it, but they had no power to do it.

I never gave up, and kept submitting ticket after ticket, hoping that someone would be able to do something for me. I never expected this to happen, but this week, I submitted a ticket and the response I got were links to 4 suicide prevention websites. I never could've seen this happening!!! Not only did I not get a direct response to the ticket, but this person was throwing me away, like I didn't matter. 

With a simple fix that I had so kindly suggested, I don't know why these tickets didn't get pushed up to higher authority for review, but rather I got the same response each time and eventually got ignored. Tickets like these that regard permabans should be looked into deeply with all context considered. They treated this like another random ticket and never truly seeked to help me.

Even if people never get to the point of permaban, I know many people out there struggle with the faulty Riot support system. I truly hope that this post attracts the light of the League community because this is way more toxic than anything I have ever experienced in the game itself. The fact that Riot wouldn't install such a simple fix, but even went as far as disregarding my issue, and "diagnosing" me with suicide.

I just want my account back, and for all those who struggle from this as well, I want my case to serve as an example so that justice can be served in the future. I am a loyal fan of 7 years to this game, and truly, this could not have made me any more disappointed. Reddit community, please serve the justice that Riot never could.

>I submitted many many support tickets, pleading that this was an isolated event and that they could even check my history to see that negative behavior had not occurred since the two week suspension. 

 It _wasn't_ an isolated incident especially if you were already at the point where you received a 2 week suspension.
 
 It takes anywhere from 1 to 3+ months for an account's punishment level to start decaying (and that's with neutral or good behavior, negative behavior will halt your progress even if it isn't enough to warrant a punishment of it's own.) How long ago was your 2 week suspension?

>Many people who have encounters with Riot support know that they go by the script, and rarely ever look into context of the situation. I repeatedly explained that this was an isolated incident, and Riot support actually AGREED! The only problem being, they saw that I was right, agreed with me, but failed to act on it. The support members even claimed that if it were up to them, they wouldn't have thought to have permabanned me, but since it is not up to them, they can't reverse it.

 Even if they disagreed with the punishment, as you already stated, that doesn't mean they can change it. Rules are rules even if some individuals disagree with them.

That's actually not always the case. There's a known bug that is capable of skipping the 2 week suspension status and instantly banning a player totally circumventing the reform system. Due to the nature of the buerocracy of the suppport system though It's impossible to report a bug in the automated feeder/leaver system. It falls in a nomans-land where tech cant help you with the UI glitches and player support can't alliviate your ban status. The UI glitches causing some players to beleive their account is only temporarily suspened while still able to spend money on riot points on a perma banned account. 

Basically this is unacceptable QA from Riot. There is a major bug in the code base that is unreportable and causing peopel to be perma-banned/spend money on that account outside the normal scope of the player behavior system. 


It's just falling through the cracks.

The bug you're describing **is not** a widespread issue, in fact it is _very_ rare. This is the only mention I've seen of it in 4+ years.

 Player support is able to undo and reduce bans in most situations when the ban is unwarranted.

Why hasn't it been addressed, don't vote me down I spent my hard earned money on an account I assumed was active. It was a BS ban given by a bot, playing baddy is not a bannable offense neither is drinking while playing. I never intentionally fed with the intention of ruining peoples experience. 

I really don't care how rare it is I am the customer it is directly affecting, all of this is ridiculous.

> I really don't care how rare it is I am the customer it is directly affecting, all of this is ridiculous.

 This is not your post. If you wish to discuss what happened to you, go to _your own_ post and comment there.

> [{quoted}](name=phammer16,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=wA36MuyJ,comment-id=,timestamp=2020-02-29T04:27:55.015+0000)

> About 2 weeks ago, my account got permabanned. In the couple games, I had used some light vulgar language (who doesn't), and so when my teammates got mad, they decided to report me and my account got flagged. Due to my account having a 2 week suspension in the past, this isolated incident resulted in a permaban.

Yes, this is how the punishment system works. When you get a 14-day suspension, Riot tells you to shape up or ship out. You chose the latter. That's not an "unjust permaban" at all; it's perfectly valid. That is why support is no longer communicating with you. Your permaban was intended to get you to leave the community and never return; support tried to explain this to you but they had no luck either.

I did shape up. It's unfortunate that my teammates had a bad game, reported me, and my chat log included very light vulgar language. What I mean by light vulgar language is cursing used in conversation (like you wouldn't go around reporting/banning people for using f*ck, etc. in normal conversation).

As I keep explaining, Riot support members have actually agreed with me in my tickets that these events are not even ban worthy, but simply because I have the 2-week suspension on record, it lead to a perma and nothing can be done.

So if they have agreed with me, why are they not reversing it? It just puzzles me that they come to a conclusion but don't carry it out.
What do you expect people here to do? I agree that Riot mishandled it. Riot support agreed that you shouldn't be banned. Now what?

Well I'm glad that you're not outright challenging my claims so first off I thank you for that. We agree, Riot "support" agrees, yet their system doesn't allow them to agree. So, there isn't anything I can technically do about it except raise awareness. If I ever wanted my account back this post would have to explode, but seeing as how people's first reactions are to challenge my situation, it's hard. I just hope that people will realize that Riot support is a scam, can be considered toxic, and that I hope people upvote and share this in light that one day I might get my account back.
They can and do remove punishments that are in error. You are misreading what they said. They did not agree you should not have been punished.

"I totally understand where you're coming from and I get your perspective. I don't doubt that you've improved and made drastic changes since the two-week suspension penalty. However, it's not really about that. It's really just that the account received a permanent ban and we cannot make any changes to the system. I know this account means a lot to you and if there was any possible way to get you back into the account, I would be more than happy to do so"

That is a direct quote with my conversation with one of the support members. They have realized the improvement from the 2 week suspension, suggest that they agree with me, but fall back on the fact that nothing can be done simply on the fact that it is a permaban.

"Again, I agree that this is not permaban worthy as a first offense but because of the escalation, a permaban was warranted."

Another quote from another member... They are once again acknowledging that this is not something worthwhile, but fall back on the reasoning of escalation of the account without context.

They didn't agree with you. They said "I understand what you're saying, but you still violated the rules".

They said you **improved**. They did not say you were behaving in alignment with the rules.

They also said "this is not permaban worthy **AS A FIRST OFFENSE**" - but it wasn't your first offense, and because of the escalation a permaban was warranted.

I'm not sure why you think you're reading what you are - they in plain English tell you that while you are being **logical**, it does not change the fact that you had your chances to improve your behavior **to be in line with the rules**.

Look at it this way - if you speed 90 mph in a school zone, but you then only go 50 mph next time, **you're still going to get an escalated ticket**. It doesn't matter you "improved" - you still broke the rules.

You seem like a very logical person. I hope we can keep this conversation constructed. I appreciate this debate. Everything you said isn't wrong. I guess it's open to interpretation. Since you use the speeding analogy, I will use it as well.

Riot has set rules in place about chat and toxic language, just like there is a speed limit. If the speed limit is 40, it is usually appropriate to go 5-10 over the limit so 45-50mph. There is some flex room to say that you are going over the limit, but it is still acceptable. Like in my scenario, where I use some language, but I'd say it wasn't excessive and over the top that would warrant anything.

But say you catch an officer on a bad day, and he pulls you over for going 8 mph over. That is the situation I'm in now. Teammates in my game had a bad time and decided to report me over something they disagreed on. Is the ticket really worth ticketing? Is the account really worth permabanning? Well the officer is gonna write me the ticket, and I am gonna get permabanned.

But afterwards, I go to the judge and appeal my ticket and he says, oh, this is not a school zone and you really weren't speeding that bad. There was no harmful intent, not like you were going 100mph in a 40 zone. Not like I attacked someone in my game. Literally just using some language which is normal. I wasn't even saying stuff that would be considered toxic!

In the end, did I break the rules? Sure you can say I did, I can't necessarily deny that. I used phrase like "r*t*rd". But did I use it in a way that was meant to attack someone, in the sense of toxicity? No, absolutely not. Did it need to be a permaban? Absolutely not! And that's what I'm asking for. I'm genuinely asking for someone to stop reading the script, and analyze this case, which they clearly did, but failed to act on.

At the end of the day, you might still not agree with me. But the most important question to answer is: Did I really violate a rule that was so serious that should result in a permaban?

Permabans should be reserved for those who intentionally cheat, int, or people that say legit hate crime level stuff about race, ethnicity, and berating people to the point of suicide. And honestly, this whole tribunal process has been more toxic to me than I could ever be to someone in the game just because the system is so ignorant to research each case and make the RIGHT human decision.

You have to keep in mind that you've been consistently going over the speed limit and caught, warned and even charged multiple times. 

Being a repeat offender  is the reason you've been permabanned.

Just to let you know. Asking for reports is considered as a harassment and we've seen plenty of people get punished for asking for reports.

In fact, there is no need to ask for reports. 1 report does the same thing as 9 reports. All a report does is to flag the system to review the game. The toxicity score returned from the review will be the same regardless of how many times a player was reported within the same game. It is also possible for the system to return a toxicity score of 0 if there was no toxicity found within the game.

It's not ever appropriate to exceed the speed limit. That's your problem - you think that "so long as it's not 'extreme' it's okay". It's not. The rules are in place for a reason. You not understanding why the rules are in place doesn't mean they're wrong, nor does it mean you can violate them, even a "little bit" (or 5-10 mph). You may *avoid* being pulled over because the cops are overworked, but "it was only 5mph" won't fly with a judge (trust me, I've tried just that).

The benefit of an automated system is there is no "bad day". It applies the rules exactly the same to all players. There is no chance of a "bad day" for the automated system - it will treat you the same yesterday as it does today as it does tomorrow.

The judge will not say "well, you were only going 5 over, thus you weren't violating the rules". They'll say "you were going 5 over, and you've been warned about this before, so this is appropriate".

This is the crux of the issue - you were told "follow the rules to the letter" and you still didn't get that. You kept speeding - even if it was only 5-10 mph over. And you got caught. You're free to disagree, but the vast majority of the community doesn't want to see toxicity of the type in your chat logs. You were given your chance to improve, and you didn't. So unfortunately, Riot doesn't give you more chances. Because more chances would most likely mean you ruin more games before ending up in the ultimate position of a permaban.

You were told with your 14 day ban that it was your final chance. You screwed up and ended up with a permaban. Over 95% of people in your position would continue this behavior if they were given another chance. Even if you're in the 5% that wouldn't, Riot can't apply special rules to you - they must apply them equally. Meaning to give you one more chance, 19 or more other players would get another chance and ruin more games. That's not acceptable.

****
Post script: I appreciate your willingness to have a constructive discussion here, and I think that now that you've experienced this, you may very well have no problems on a new account. That unfortunately does not change the fact that Riot cannot make some special exception for you and not apply it to other players as well, the vast majority of which would ruin more games after the "exception" was applied.
Can you try calling Riot through the phone? If that fails can you at least get some refund. $1000 dollars to too much to lose from a dumb ban.
